channel.title: [508]Adding D Claw Models[Berky-Scape Client]
channel.description:
Hi.
I'm looking for someone to assist me in adding models in Berky-Scape's Client.
I have looked in the help section and searched using the search bar with no conclusion.
If anyone can help me with my problem I'd greatly appreciate it!
Thanks and all the best,Socco.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 07, 2009, 01:40:46 pm[/size][hr]Anyone?

item.title: [508]Adding D Claw Models[Berky-Scape Client]
item.dc:creator: @socco socco
item.description:
@socco wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:2, topic:282689”]Add these to class8.java

[code] if(i == 14484)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wield”;
class8.aStringArray189[4] = “Drop”;
class8.anInt174 = 13698;
class8.anInt181 = 738;
class8.anInt190 = 245;
class8.anInt198 = 80;
class8.anInt169 = -2;
class8.anInt194 = 3;
class8.anInt165 = 13699;
class8.anInt200 = 13699;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.aString170 = “Dragon claws”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “A set of fighting claws.”.getBytes();
}

	if(i == 14484)
	{
	class8.aStringArray189 = null;
	class8.anInt163 = 799;
	class8.anInt179 = 14484;
	}[/code]

I’ve attached some models to the bottom of the post. Gzip them and add them to your models folder.

Once they’re added login to your client and type
“add model 13699”
and
“add model 13698”

then restart your client.[/quote]

I dont have a models folder and no models are coming up in my Class8.java. [br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 07, 2009, 02:46:12 pm[/size][hr]I added that to Class8.java and got 19 errors!

Read full topic

item.title: [508]Adding D Claw Models[Berky-Scape Client]
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Add these to class8.java

[code] if(i == 14484)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wield”;
class8.aStringArray189[4] = “Drop”;
class8.anInt174 = 13698;
class8.anInt181 = 738;
class8.anInt190 = 245;
class8.anInt198 = 80;
class8.anInt169 = -2;
class8.anInt194 = 3;
class8.anInt165 = 13699;
class8.anInt200 = 13699;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.aString170 = “Dragon claws”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “A set of fighting claws.”.getBytes();
}

	if(i == 14484)
	{
	class8.aStringArray189 = null;
	class8.anInt163 = 799;
	class8.anInt179 = 14484;
	}[/code]

I’ve attached some models to the bottom of the post. Gzip them and add them to your models folder.

Once they’re added login to your client and type
“add model 13699”
and
“add model 13698”

then restart your client.

Read full topic
